page.title: List of students at South Park Elementary

rev.comment: /* Craig Tucker */ rm wikia link, rm non-free image added indiscriminately to a list per [[WP:NFLISTS]]
rev.diff:
Line 24: Line 24:
'''Craig Tucker''', commonly characterized by his blue chullo hat and nasal, monotone voice, is one of the more prominent members of the children's classroom. Cartman once claimed that Craig was the "biggest troublemaker in [their] class",<ref name="Tweek"/> and parents of his classmates have cited him as a "bad influence".<ref name="Pandemic">{{cite episode |title=[[Pandemic (South Park)|Pandemic]] |url= |series= [[South Park]] |credits=[[Trey Parker|Parker, Trey]] (writer) |station= [[Comedy Central]]|airdate=2009-10-22 |season=12 |number=177 |minutes= }}</ref> In a [[running gag]] during the show's earlier seasons, [[establishing shot]]s of [[Mr. Mackey]]'s office would feature Craig waiting outside.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.southparkstudios.com/fans/faq/archives.php?id=1695 |title=FAQ Archives: Who is that kid who always sit in front of Mr. Mackeys office who flips people off? | accessdate=2009-05-13 |date=2001-06-27 |work=South Park Studios}}</ref> Craig has a habit of giving people [[finger (gesture)|the finger]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.southparkstudios.com/fans/characters/81|title=Craig|accessdate=2008-10-13 |work=South Park Studios}}</ref> a trait the show's official website attributes to his learning the behavior from his family, all of whom frequently use the gesture as well.<ref name="Tweek">{{cite episode |title=[[Tweek vs. Craig]] |url= |series= [[South Park]] |credits=[[Trey Parker|Parker, Trey]], [[Matt Stone|Stone, Matt]] and [[Pam Brady|Brady, Pam]] (writers) |station= [[Comedy Central]]|airdate=1999-06-23 |season=3 |number=36 |minutes= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.southparkstudios.com/fans/faq/archives.php?id=4737|title=FAQ - South Park Studios|publisher=www.southparkstudios.com|accessdate=2009-05-16|last=|first=}}</ref> This trait was last seen in the [[South Park (season 6)|Season 6 (2002)]] episode "Fun With Veal". Craig wears a blue jacket and matching blue [[chullo hat]]
'''Craig Tucker''', commonly characterized by his blue chullo hat and nasal, monotone voice, is one of the more prominent members of the children's classroom. Cartman once claimed that Craig was the "biggest troublemaker in [their] class",<ref name="Tweek"/> and parents of his classmates have cited him as a "bad influence".<ref name="Pandemic">{{cite episode |title=[[Pandemic (South Park)|Pandemic]] |url= |series= [[South Park]] |credits=[[Trey Parker|Parker, Trey]] (writer) |station= [[Comedy Central]]|airdate=2009-10-22 |season=12 |number=177 |minutes= }}</ref> In a [[running gag]] during the show's earlier seasons, [[establishing shot]]s of [[Mr. Mackey]]'s office would feature Craig waiting outside.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.southparkstudios.com/fans/faq/archives.php?id=1695 |title=FAQ Archives: Who is that kid who always sit in front of Mr. Mackeys office who flips people off? | accessdate=2009-05-13 |date=2001-06-27 |work=South Park Studios}}</ref> Craig has a habit of giving people [[finger (gesture)|the finger]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.southparkstudios.com/fans/characters/81|title=Craig|accessdate=2008-10-13 |work=South Park Studios}}</ref> a trait the show's official website attributes to his learning the behavior from his family, all of whom frequently use the gesture as well.<ref name="Tweek">{{cite episode |title=[[Tweek vs. Craig]] |url= |series= [[South Park]] |credits=[[Trey Parker|Parker, Trey]], [[Matt Stone|Stone, Matt]] and [[Pam Brady|Brady, Pam]] (writers) |station= [[Comedy Central]]|airdate=1999-06-23 |season=3 |number=36 |minutes= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.southparkstudios.com/fans/faq/archives.php?id=4737|title=FAQ - South Park Studios|publisher=www.southparkstudios.com|accessdate=2009-05-16|last=|first=}}</ref> This trait was last seen in the [[South Park (season 6)|Season 6 (2002)]] episode "Fun With Veal". Craig wears a blue jacket and matching blue [[chullo hat]]
â
Craig dislikes the [[List of characters in South Park#Main characters|four main characters]] and rivals them in several episodes. Craig is a [[Pragmatism|pragmatist]]<ref>{{Cite news |last=O'Neal |first=Sean |title=South Park: Season 13: Episode 5: "Fishsticks" |work=[[The A.V. Club]] |date=2009-04-08 |url=http://www.avclub.com/articles/fishsticks,26396/ |accessdate=2009-05-13}}</ref> and has no wish of being involved in any extraordinary adventures the other main characters on the show customarily experience.<ref name="411maniaPandemic2"/> In the [[South Park (season 12)|season 12]] (2008) episodes "[[Pandemic (South Park)|Pandemic]]" and "[[Pandemic 2 - The Startling]]", Craig repeatedly castigates the main characters' propensity to have a pursued activity or idea disproportionately backfire. Despite his hatred for adventure, he plays a crucial role in these two episodes, saving the world from guinea animals, but is shown even after doing so unintentionally to care little.<ref name="411maniaPandemic2">{{cite web |url=http://www.411mania.com/movies/dvd_reviews/89107/South-Park-10.29.08:-Pandemic-2---The-Startling.htm |title=South Park 10.29.08: Pandemic 2 - The Startling |accessdate=2008-10-29 |author=Perry, DC |date=2008-11-02 |work=411mania.com }}</ref><ref name="IGNPandemic">{{cite web |title=IGN: Pandemic Review |url=http://tv.ign.com/articles/922/922947p1.html |author=Fickett, Travis |publisher=[[IGN]] |date=2008-10-23 |accessdate=2008-11-02}}</ref> Craig is one of the most often-used of the boys' extended group, often providing lines in group scenes with the other children. He is voiced by series co-creator Matt Stone.[[File:NameOfImage.png|thumb|Craig Tucker]] http://southparkfanon.wikia.com/wiki/Craig
+
Craig dislikes the [[List of characters in South Park#Main characters|four main characters]] and rivals them in several episodes. Craig is a [[Pragmatism|pragmatist]]<ref>{{Cite news |last=O'Neal |first=Sean |title=South Park: Season 13: Episode 5: "Fishsticks" |work=[[The A.V. Club]] |date=2009-04-08 |url=http://www.avclub.com/articles/fishsticks,26396/ |accessdate=2009-05-13}}</ref> and has no wish of being involved in any extraordinary adventures the other main characters on the show customarily experience.<ref name="411maniaPandemic2"/> In the [[South Park (season 12)|season 12]] (2008) episodes "[[Pandemic (South Park)|Pandemic]]" and "[[Pandemic 2 - The Startling]]", Craig repeatedly castigates the main characters' propensity to have a pursued activity or idea disproportionately backfire. Despite his hatred for adventure, he plays a crucial role in these two episodes, saving the world from guinea animals, but is shown even after doing so unintentionally to care little.<ref name="411maniaPandemic2">{{cite web |url=http://www.411mania.com/movies/dvd_reviews/89107/South-Park-10.29.08:-Pandemic-2---The-Startling.htm |title=South Park 10.29.08: Pandemic 2 - The Startling |accessdate=2008-10-29 |author=Perry, DC |date=2008-11-02 |work=411mania.com }}</ref><ref name="IGNPandemic">{{cite web |title=IGN: Pandemic Review |url=http://tv.ign.com/articles/922/922947p1.html |author=Fickett, Travis |publisher=[[IGN]] |date=2008-10-23 |accessdate=2008-11-02}}</ref> Craig is one of the most often-used of the boys' extended group, often providing lines in group scenes with the other children. He is voiced by series co-creator Matt Stone.
===Eric Cartman===
===Eric Cartman===
